metadata.Title: CVE-2018-21035 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In Qt through 5.14.1, the WebSocket implementation accepts up to 2GB for frames and 2GB for messages. Smaller limits cannot be configured. This makes it easier for attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption).

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream commit just adds new settings allowing users to lower allowed frame/message size, it doesn't change the default behaviour

criterions.comment: qtwebsockets-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
